title: Potential memory leak on Eth_GetLogs

labels.name: TeamChupa
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Chupacabara Team

body:
<!-- Have you done the following? -->
<!--   * read the Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to -->  
<!--     comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: -->
<!--     https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md -->
<!--   * Reproduced the issue in the latest version of the software -->
<!--   * Read the debugging docs: https://besu.hyperledger.org/en/stable/HowTo/Monitor/Logging/ -->
<!--   * Duplicate Issue check:  https://github.com/search?q=+is%3Aissue+repo%3Ahyperledger/Besu -->
<!-- Note:  Not all sections will apply to all issue types. -->

### Description
A discord user reported an OOM Killer event on Besu. When the event occurred, Besu was consuming more than 24.5 GiB. 
```
Out of memory: Killed process 58403 (java) total-vm:31612904kB, anon-rss:24522548kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:8996kB, UID:1000 pgtables:57052kB oom_score_adj:0
```
The user calls Eth_GetLogs every five minutes to get logs with a small range of blocks (tens of blocks).


### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
Call Eth_GetLogs with small range of blocks (tens of blocks) every 5 minutes on a synced node.

**Expected behavior:** 
Besu shouldn't run out of memory.

**Actual behavior:** 
Besu consumes all available memory until being OOM killed.

**Frequency:** 
TBD

### Versions 
* Besu version : besu/v22.10.3/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-19

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)
* System info - memory, CPU : 32 GiB RAM
@macfarla @daniellehrner - Have we made any changes to this method recently that could cause memory challenges?

the only change I know of recently is this one https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/4597 which checks the to/from params. It did require wiring through the maxLogsRange param but can't see how that change would cause this issue
Is it known that this was working before any recent changes? Perhaps this pattern of usage is uncommon and is uncovering an old issue?
I've now been running for a week without reproducing the OOM. Would be curious if anyone got it to repro.

@xrchz do you have a similar use case?
> The user calls Eth_GetLogs every five minutes to get logs with a small range of blocks (tens of blocks)
Yes. I am also "the user".
oh hi!

we haven't managed to reproduce this one either - wonder if there was something different about the timeframe / blocks / load when the OOM happened for you?

Are you ok if we close this ticket? We can always reopen it if the problem recurs.
Yep I'm happy to close for now and will re-open if it recurs.

It happened again yesterday:
`Out of memory: Killed process 416419 (java) total-vm:37073904kB, anon-rss:23986352kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:8996kB, UID:1000 pgtables:65036kB oom_score_adj:0`

Hi @xrchz,
Sorry I couldn't find our discussion in Discord, I don't remember if you have Besu Grafana dashboard. 
I wanted to check the heap usage/committed when the process is killed, and your java heap configuration (-Xmx).
If the process get killed before Java is running Out Of Memory, this could be a memory leak in the native memory (ex. non closed RocksDB resources).

Sorry I don't have Grafana. Here's the heap configuration: `BESU_OPTS=-Xmx8g`.
Not sure what you mean by heap usage/committed when killed - where can I check?
@daniellehrner - tracking elsewhere?

@xrchz You can check heap usage/committed when a java process is killed only on your monitoring tool, in our case Grafana. If you decide to install Grafana with Besu Full Dashboard, the Panel is in "Java Memory Management" section

Died again today `Jan 27 11:28:39 kernel: Out of memory: Killed process 692718 (java) total-vm:47951864kB, anon-rss:23041952kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:8996kB, UID:1000 pgtables:82044kB oom_score_adjust=0`

I'm running currently a Java batch to try to reproduce. My java process is getting logs for one eth address every 20 seconds (instead of every 5 minutes to speed up memory growth), from latest - 10 blocks to latest (on mainnet). Do you think this is similar to your use case ?
Yes that sounds close enough to me. You might want the calls to filter on topics or something if it doesn't reproduce.
Any progress here? I was running fine for weeks, but then got a couple of OOMs again in the past 2 days.
It's possible that there's some additional activity that triggers the leak, specifically an occasional `eth_getTransactionReceipt` alongside the periodic `eth_getLogs` mentioned already.

@xrchz I wasn't able to reproduce, this new pre-release https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/releases/tag/untagged-b13f6c098d1772aa0feb has a better memory management. Could you give it a try. The release is not a final one, don't use it in production environment.
I have seen this occur on `besu/v23.1.2/linux-x86_64/openjdk-java-19`

Hi @xrchz,
Could you test with OpenJ9 JDK implementation : https://github.com/ibmruntimes/semeru17-binaries/releases/download/jdk-17.0.5%2B8_openj9-0.35.0/ibm-semeru-open-jdk_x64_linux_17.0.5_8_openj9-0.35.0.tar.gz, If you're running on docker, just wait few days for our docker image to be available>
If you're running natively on linux, I can help to setup OpenJ JRE.
You can check this issue https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/issues/5327 for more context.
